comments:
The first time the JSFAppConfigMgr is called (and therefore lazy initialized) from the EL content assist, the following exception appears in the log.

To reproduce, launch Eclipse, open an a JSP page and perform a content assist operation in an EL expression that involves a managed bean such as "bean.".  Do a ctrl-space after the '.'.

DIAGNOSTIC:

The root of the problem is a file not found error trying get the file:
C:\Documents and Settings\cbateman.ST-USERS\runtime-New_configuration\ELValidationTestCases\WebContent\WEB-INF\lib\commons-beanutils.jar

Strangely, the file *is* there.  I suspect that the problem may be rooted in either the spaces in "Documents and Settings" or the length of the path.

Issue does not appear to be related to length of path or specific characters (including spaces) in path. New evidence suggests project rename results in old path being searched instead of new path. Still investigating.

After consultation with Cam and much trying to get this to break, I cannot reproduce. Only seems to happen with one specific web application of Cam's, and have tried to reproduce on my system to no avail. We will re-open if it ever appears again.

traces.message: The system cannot find the path specified
